best_span_str: Herc used the record to focus on a short, heavily percussive part in it: the "break".
Since this part of the record was the one the dancers liked best, Herc isolated the break and prolonged it by changing between two record players.
According to music journalist Steven Ivory, in 1973, Herc placed on the turntables two copies of Brown's 1970 Sex Machine album
On August 11, 1973, DJ Kool Herc was a disc jockey and emcee at a party in the recreation room at Sedgwick Avenue.
The album quickly went gold, with a peak of No. 19 on the album charts.
After two years of writing and recording, White Lion released their fourth album Mane Attraction in the spring of 1991.
The band's success continued with more constant touring.
